Package self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations

Class Summary
AbstractAnnotation Superclass for abstract annotations which are the parents to classes which handle the annotations in a layout
AbstractInvisible Superclass required for loading Invisible Objects using the Invisible annotation
AbstractLayoutAdapter Superclass required for loading LayoutAdapter Objects into the layout
AnnotatedLayoutInflater Layout Inflater to be used with the Annotated Layout Framework.
ClassAnnotationInflater Superclass to all annotation-based view inflaters.
EmbedInflater Embeds a layout file into the current layout
FieldAnnotationInflater This class handles declared fields during layout inflation.
InvisibleInflater Used to add an invisible element into an AbLE layout
LayoutAdapterInflater Inflates a view from a class in a layout file that uses the LayoutAdapter annotation
LayoutInflater Inflate a View from a class that declares a Layout annotation
XMLLayoutInflater Creates a View from an Android Layout XML file.
 

Enum Summary
ORIENTATION Defines the behavior of how a layout handles a screen rotation
 

Exception Summary
MissingAnnotationException Thrown when an expected annotation is missing
 

Annotation Types Summary
Binding Allows a value to be set based on changes to another value.
Embed Used in layout to specify that another layout file should be added within the layout.
Getter This annotation deprecates InstanceMethod by providing its functionality in addition to passing parameters to the method.
InstanceMethod Deprecated. use Getter
Invisible This annotation specifies that a class does not create a View object, but is an invisible entity, such as a noise or sound.
Layout Class documentation for defining a layout programmatically
Benefits of doing layout this way: Use Code, which is more comfortable and more customizable Create Objects that are not views Create AdapterViews easily
LayoutAdapter Provides a class template that provides callbacks for getting a view object programmatically and inserting it into the layout.
Setter Specifies a setter that requires multiple arguments.
Variable This indicates at a field should be treated as a variable instead of a setter
XMLLayout Defines a layout that is inflated from XML
